conversation.content: True or False? If (b_n) coverges to b then |b_n| converges to b.
False. If \(b_n \to b\), then \(|b_n| \to |b|\), not \(b\). The limit of the absolute values is the absolute value of the limit.

Yes, the statement is false. Convergence of \(b_n\) to \(b\) implies \(|b_n|\) converges to \(|b|\), not to \(b\). For example, if \(b = -1\), then \(|b| = 1\), so \(|b_n|\) converges to 1, not \(-1\).
